uk.ac.ed.csbe.sbsivisual.sbsiDataFormat
Class SBSIResourceFactory

java.lang.Object
  uk.ac.ed.csbe.sbsivisual.sbsiDataFormat.SBSIResourceFactory

public class SBSIResourceFactory
extends java.lang.Object

Factory class for accessing SBSI data format functionality. This class is the main point of access for clients wishing to handle SBSI data format files.

Author:
Richard Adams

Method Detail

readSBSIDataFile

public SBSIDataDocument readSBSIDataFile(java.lang.String filename)
                                  throws SBSIParseException
Reads an SBSI-format data file.

Parameters:
filename - A Valid readable file
Returns:
An SBSIDataDocument
Throws:
SBSIParseException - if file cannot be parsed.

readSBSIHeaderFile

public SBSIHeaderDocument readSBSIHeaderFile(java.lang.String filename)
                                      throws SBSIParseException
Reads and validates an SBSI header file.

This method reads the file afresh at each invocation. Therefore two invocations of this method may return two SBSIHeaderDocuments that return different different ISBSIHeaders.

Parameters:
filename - The path of a valid readable file
Returns:
An SBSIHeaderDocument
Throws:
SBSIParseException - if file cannot be parsed.

readSBSIDataFromString

public static SBSIDataDocument readSBSIDataFromString(java.util.List<java.lang.String> lines)
Reads a data document, given as a List of lines

Parameters:
lines - A List of Strings representing an SBSI data document.
Returns:
An SBSIDataDocument

writeSBSIHeader

public void writeSBSIHeader(ISBSIHeader header,
                            java.io.File outFile)
                     throws SBSIParseException,
                            java.io.IOException
Attempts to write an ISBSIHeader header. Before writing, performs a validation step, and throws an SBSIParseException if validation fails. This is to ensure that header objects generated programatically are written in a valid form.

Parameters:
header - A non-null ISBSIHeader object
outFile - A non-null File object that can be written to.
Throws:
SBSIParseException - If header is not syntactically valid.
java.io.IOException

writeSBSIData

public static void writeSBSIData(ISBSIData data,
                                 java.io.File outFile)
                          throws java.io.IOException
Throws:
java.io.IOException

readSBSIHeaderFile

public SBSIHeaderDocument readSBSIHeaderFile(java.io.File data)
                                      throws SBSIParseException
Given the file path to a data file, will return an SBSIHeaderDocument corresponding to the header file referred to in the data document

Parameters:
data - a file contqining an SBSIDATA document
Returns:
The corresponding SBSIHeader document which MUST EXIST IN THE SAME DIRECTORY as the data file
Throws:
SBSIParseException

getSBSIHeaderMatchingSBSIData

public SBSIHeaderDocument getSBSIHeaderMatchingSBSIData(java.lang.String path,
                                                        java.lang.String dataName)
                                                 throws SBSIParseException
Deprecated. Use SBSIHeaderDocument getHeaderFromDataFile(File dataFile) instead, which does not have the restriction that the data file and header file are in same directories

Parameters:
path - the file path to an SBSIDATA document
dataname - the file name to an SBSIDATA document
Returns:
The corresponding SBSIHeader document which MUST EXIST IN THE SAME DIRECTORY as the data file
Throws:
SBSIParseException

getInstance

public static SBSIResourceFactory getInstance()

createSBSIHeader

public ISBSIHeader createSBSIHeader()
Preferred way to create an SBSIHeader

Returns:
An empty, valid ISBIHeader, which can be written to file but contains no annotation.
